title: Ticket #13: submit -spool and transfer_executable = false
description: Seems when you run condor_submit -spool on a job that has transfer_executable = false the executable gets transferred, at least to the spool directory. This seems like a bug.
remarks:
2009-Jan-29 16:46:58 by tannenba:
This is the documented behavior ... but yeah, it seems silly. If you aren't gonna transfer the executable to the execute machine, why spool it?

2009-Jan-29 16:59:51 by matt:
Where's it documented to say that's the intended behavior? I think it's just something that got missed.

man condor_submit -spool says "spool all required ..." along with transfer_executable saying "does not transfer executable over"

It seems like the when transfer_executable=false is specified it means that it's not required to be spool the executable.

transfer_executable should trump -spool, copy_to_spool should also be tested when this is fixed.

2010-Jan-16 08:20:16 by matt:
See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=456482

This does not appear to be a problem in 7.4 series.
check_ins: 2013-Sep-24 07:41   Check-in [46547]: Merged [46541], Merge pull request #13 from zhangzhehust/network_namespaces fix compilation error (By Brian Bockelman )
creator: matt
